required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study on the Efficacy and Safety of VEC Intravenous Chemotherapy Combined With Conbercept Intravitreal Injection in the Treatment of Retinoblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study on the Efficacy and Safety of VEC Intravenous Chemotherapy Combined With Conbercept Intravitreal Injection in the Treatment of Retinoblastoma

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, multi-center, open single-arm Phase II clinical trial is designed to investigate the efficacy and safety of intravenous chemotherapy combined with Conbercept intravitreal injection in the treatment of retinoblastoma.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the 1-year ocular salvage rate of intravenous chemotherapy combined with Conbercept intravitreal injection in the treatment of retinoblastoma
primary_outcome.description: 12-month ocular salvage rate: calculate the number and percentage of subjects who reach 12-month ocular salvage rate, and use the exact probability method to estimate 95% CI.

intervention.description: Monthly injection of Conbercept from 0~5 months

facility.name: The Second Xiangya Hospital Of Central South University
Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine
